summaryText: Wow, what an incredible Christmas Eve message from Pastor Travis Hearn about stepping out of darkness and coming home to Jesus! Pastor Travis delivered a powerful sermon reminding us that Jesus is the True Light that can illuminate our lives and rescue us from confusion, isolation, and potential destruction. He masterfully used real-life illustrations, like his personal story of getting a DUI that ultimately led him to Christ, to demonstrate how God's light can transform our darkest moments. The message wasn't just about acknowledging darkness, but about actively choosing to step into the light of Jesus Christ. Pastor Travis challenged listeners to recognize the 'fake lights' in their lives - relationships, addictions, and worldly distractions - and instead turn to the genuine, life-changing light of Christ. His passionate plea was simple yet profound: 'Come home, it's getting dark out there.' Through personal storytelling and biblical references, he painted a vivid picture of how sin can slowly pull us away, like waves pulling a swimmer out to sea, but God's love is always ready to rescue us.
mainPoints: Wandering in darkness destroys your ability to see clearly
Staying in darkness will eventually cause you to fall
God's light exposes darkness and offers rescue

versesMentioned.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. He was with God in the beginning. Through him all things were made; without him nothing was made that has been made. In him was life, and that life was the light of all mankind. The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.
When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, 'I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.'
I have come into the world as a light, so that no one who believes in me should stay in darkness.
The god of this age has blinded the minds of unbelievers, so that they cannot see the light of the gospel that displays the glory of Christ, who is the image of God.
Woe to those who call evil good and good evil, who put darkness for light and light for darkness, who put bitter for sweet and sweet for bitter.

So I tell you this, and insist on it in the Lord, that you must no longer live as the Gentiles do, in the futility of their thinking. They are darkened in their understanding and separated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in them due to the hardening of their hearts. Having lost all sensitivity, they have given themselves over to sensuality so as to indulge in every kind of impurity, and they are full of greed. That, however, is not the way of life you learned when you heard about Christ and were taught in him in accordance with the truth that is in Jesus. You were taught, with regard to your former way of life, to put off your old self, which is being corrupted by its deceitful desires; to be made new in the attitude of your minds; and to put on the new self, created to be like God in true righteousness and holiness.
Be alert and of sober mind. Your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour.
But everything exposed by the light becomes visible, and everything that is illuminated becomes a light.
The Lord is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid?
If you declare with your mouth, 'Jesus is Lord,' and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
For he has rescued us from the dominion of darkness and brought us into the kingdom of the Son he loves.

Monday.scripture: John 3:19-21: 'This is the verdict: Light has come into the world, but people loved darkness instead of light because their deeds were evil. Everyone who does evil hates the light, and will not come into the light for fear that their deeds will be exposed. But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that it may be seen plainly that what they have done has been done in the sight of God.'
Monday.focus: Identifying areas of darkness in my life
Monday.action: Create a personal inventory of areas where you might be avoiding God's light. Write down specific situations or habits you've been hiding or rationalizing.
Monday.prayer: Lord, shine Your light into the hidden corners of my heart. Give me the courage to be honest about the darkness in my life and the willingness to step into Your transformative light. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Psalm 139:23-24: 'Search me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts. See if there is any offensive way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.'
Tuesday.focus: Allowing God to expose and heal hidden areas
Tuesday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection, asking God to reveal any areas of your life where you're living in spiritual darkness. Journal your insights and prayers.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, I surrender my heart to You. Reveal any areas of darkness, confusion, or sin. Give me the strength to step into Your light and receive Your healing. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Matthew 5:14-16: 'You are the light of the world. A town built on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'
Wednesday.focus: Being a light in dark places
Wednesday.action: Intentionally look for an opportunity to bring hope, encouragement, or kindness to someone in a difficult situation today.
Wednesday.prayer: God, use me as Your instrument of light today. Help me shine Your love in dark places and be a source of hope and encouragement to those around me. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Ephesians 5:8-10: 'For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Live as children of light (for the fruit of the light consists in all goodness, righteousness and truth) and find out what pleases the Lord.'
Thursday.focus: Understanding my identity as a child of light
Thursday.action: Make a list of ways you can practically demonstrate God's light in your daily interactions. Consider how your words, actions, and attitudes can reflect Christ.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me live as a child of light. Transform my thinking and actions so that I reflect Your goodness, righteousness, and truth in every situation. Amen.

Friday.scripture: James 1:17: 'Every good and perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of the heavenly lights, who does not change like shifting shadows.'
Friday.action: Count and journal 10 specific ways God has been consistently good in your life, even during dark seasons.
Friday.prayer: Faithful Father, thank You for Your unchanging love and light. Help me recognize and appreciate the good gifts You continually provide, even in challenging times. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Isaiah 42:16: 'I will lead the blind by ways they have not known, along unfamiliar paths I will guide them; I will turn the darkness into light before them and make the rough places smooth. These are the things I will do; I will not forsake them.'
Saturday.action: Identify an area of uncertainty in your life. Spend time in prayer, surrendering this area to God and asking Him to guide you from darkness into His light.
Saturday.prayer: God of hope, I trust You to guide me through uncertain times. Where I feel lost or confused, illuminate my path. Lead me in Your wisdom and light. I surrender my fears and trust in Your unfailing love. Amen.
